label: Outlook Calendar
description: rcade.dev LLM tools for Outlook Calendar

tools.name: CreateEvent
tools.description:
Create an event in the authenticated user's default calendar.

Ignores timezone offsets provided in the start_date_time and end_date_time parameters.
Instead, uses the user's default calendar timezone to filter events.
If the user has not set a timezone for their calendar, then the timezone will be UTC.

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: The text of the event's subject (title) line.

parameters.name: start_date_time
parameters.description: The datetime of the event's start, represented in ISO 8601 format. Timezone offset is ignored. For example, 2025-04-25T13:00:00

parameters.name: end_date_time
parameters.description: The datetime of the event's end, represented in ISO 8601 format. Timezone offset is ignored. For example, 2025-04-25T13:30:00

parameters.name: attendee_emails
parameters.description: The email addresses of the attendees of the event. Must be valid email addresses e.g., username@domain.com.

parameters.name: is_online_meeting
parameters.description: Whether the event is an online meeting. Defaults to False

parameters.name: custom_meeting_url
parameters.description: The URL of the online meeting. If not provided and is_online_meeting is True, then a url will be generated for you

output.description: A dictionary containing the created event details

body.value: Discuss project updates and next steps.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetEvent
tools.description: Get an event by its ID from the user's calendar.

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: The ID of the event to get

output.description: A dictionary containing the event details

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ListEventsInTimeRange
tools.description:
List events in the user's calendar in a specific time range.

Ignores timezone offsets provided in the start_date_time and end_date_time parameters.
Instead, uses the user's default calendar timezone to filter events.
If the user has not set a timezone for their calendar, then the timezone will be UTC.

parameters.name: start_date_time
parameters.description: The start date and time of the time range, represented in ISO 8601 format. Timezone offset is ignored. For example, 2025-04-24T19:00:00

parameters.name: end_date_time
parameters.description: The end date and time of the time range, represented in ISO 8601 format. Timezone offset is ignored. For example, 2025-04-24T19:30:00

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of events to return. Max 1000. Defaults to 10

output.description: A dictionary containing a list of events

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: WhoAmI
tools.description: Get information about the current user and their Outlook Calendar environment.

output.description: Get comprehensive user profile and Outlook Calendar information.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

documentationChunks.content:
## Auth

<Callout type="info">
The Arcade Outlook Calendar MCP Server uses the [Microsoft auth provider](/references/auth-providers/microsoft) to connect to users' Microsoft accounts.
</Callout>

summary:
Arcade Toolkit for Outlook Calendar provides developers with powerful integrations utilizing Microsoftâ€™s OAuth2 authentication. This toolkit empowers users to proficiently manage calendar events and retrieve user details.

**Capabilities**
- Create and manage calendar events seamlessly in users' default calendar.
- Retrieve detailed event information by event ID.
- List events occurring within specified time ranges, taking into account default calendar time zones.
- Access current user information and their Outlook Calendar environment effortlessly.

**OAuth**
- Provider: Microsoft
- Scopes: Calendars.ReadBasic, Calendars.ReadWrite, MailboxSettings.Read, User.Read
